page.title: 11Witch Hunts,16C,Manningtree
page.content: Manningtree Green looks peaceful today but in the 16th century Matthew Hopkins executed many, so called, witches. Nowadays it stands as a lonely memorial. During the years 1560 to 1645 75 witches were hung. He did various tests to see whether they were witches or not, one was where the witch was thrown into the river. If she floated she was guilty if not, she was innocent. This process was called swimming witches. Matthew Hopkins was hung in 1649 after he too was accused of being a witch. Nowadays, when people take a photo of the Thorn Hotel, they say they have seen his ghost. By Kathryn Clark & Claire Guenarie, aged 12 years.
